content: the beads should all be laying flat but secure in their chain 3 cages to sew a button onto this end tie all of the tail ends together with two or three snug but not too tight square knots to create an extension of sorts this gives you a bit of fabric to imbed the shank of your button and sew it on with one of the tail ends finish off the ends using your preferred method for a connector-type closure examples pictured thread the end of the bead strand yarn that is coming out of one end onto a yarn needle and working into both the connector and the chain 3 space thread it twice around one side of the bead on the end and twice around the other side of the bead this will ensure that the connector is centered weave in and finish off this yarn end using your preferred method attaching a connector-type finding with 2 wraps on either side of the first bead now you will need to sew a jump ring with a matching lobster claw clasp or any type of connector on the other end in the same manner as you attached the opposite connector i like to thread all 3 yarn ends that are here onto the needle and sew the jump ring on it gives added security and eliminates three separate ends wrapping only once around on either side of the last bead is enough if you use all three ends at the same time finish off the ends using your preferred method the perlina beaded bracelet copyright © june 2022 7 photo 1 photo 2 after 6 repeats photo 3 photo 4 after 6 repeats photo 5 end of edging round the perlina beaded bracelet copyright © june 2022 8 additional notes and modifications i used a 3mm hook instead of a 3 5 mm on this owl bracelet with yarn bee authentic hand-dyed tonal which is slightly thicker than loops and threads woolike simili-laine because these owl beads were a tad longer than 25 i chained 4 for the cage instead of 3 also these owl beads were heavier than the other beads i used and they wanted to turn and lay on their side to solve this problem i strung the owl beads onto two strands of yarn at the first step this created more friction and allowed them to lay flat i love those owls ❤ as you work up a couple of these perlinas different inspiration ideas alternatives and solutions e g my heavy twisting long owl problem will come to you as they did to me ● keep going for another round of edging to make a wider bracelet or strap chain 2 at the ends instead of 1 and chain 1 between each single_crochet chain 2 single_crochet be sure to adjust the size and placement of the closure here are two photos with an additional round ● make a classy choker a pretty strap
